diseases.name: Acne
remedies: Keep your face clean by washing it twice daily with a gentle cleanser.
Use oil-free skincare products to avoid clogging pores.
Avoid touching your face with dirty hands to prevent bacteria transfer.
Use non-comedogenic makeup and sunscreen.
Keep your hair clean and away from your face, especially if it's oily.
Avoid excessive sun exposure and use non-comedogenic sunscreen.
Eat a balanced diet with plenty of fruits, vegetables, and water.
Limit sugary and greasy foods, which can exacerbate acne.
Try over-the-counter acne treatments containing ingredients like benzoyl peroxide or salicylic acid.
Manage stress through relaxation techniques like yoga or meditation.
Consider seeing a dermatologist for personalized treatment options if acne persists.

diseases.name: AIDS
remedies: Adhering to antiretroviral therapy (ART) as prescribed by healthcare providers.
Regularly monitoring viral load and CD4 cell count through blood tests.
Maintaining a healthy lifestyle with balanced nutrition and regular exercise.
Practicing safer sex by using condoms to prevent transmission of HIV.
Avoiding sharing needles or other injection equipment if injecting drugs.
Seeking mental health support and counseling to cope with emotional challenges.
Participating in support groups and community organizations for people living with HIV/AIDS.
Getting vaccinated against other infections to prevent additional health complications.
Avoiding smoking, excessive alcohol consumption, and illicit drug use.
Educating oneself and others about HIV/AIDS to reduce stigma and discrimination.

diseases.name: Alcoholic hepatitis
remedies: Abstain from alcohol completely to prevent further liver damage.
Seek medical help for detoxification and withdrawal management if necessary.
Follow a balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, lean proteins, and whole grains.
Avoid foods high in fat, salt, and sugar, as well as processed and fried foods.
Stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water and avoiding excessive caffeine.
Take prescribed medications as directed by healthcare providers, which may include corticosteroids or other anti-inflammatory drugs.
Attend support groups or counseling sessions to address alcohol dependence and promote sobriety.
Get vaccinated against hepatitis A and hepatitis B to prevent additional liver infections.
Monitor liver function through regular check-ups and blood tests.
Consider liver transplantation in severe cases where other treatments have failed.
Manage any underlying conditions such as obesity, diabetes, or high cholesterol.

diseases.name: Allergy
remedies: Identify and avoid allergens that trigger your allergic reactions.
Keep windows closed during high pollen seasons and use air purifiers indoors.
Wash bedding and clothes frequently in hot water to remove allergens.
Use allergen-proof covers for pillows and mattresses.
Keep pets out of the bedroom and off furniture to reduce exposure to pet dander.
Use saline nasal rinses to clear nasal passages of allergens.
Take over-the-counter antihistamines or decongestants to relieve symptoms.
Consider prescription medications such as corticosteroids or leukotriene inhibitors for more severe allergies.
Use allergy shots (immunotherapy) to desensitize the immune system to specific allergens over time.
Try alternative therapies like acupuncture or herbal supplements under the guidance of a healthcare professional.
Keep an allergy diary to track symptoms and identify patterns of allergen exposure.
Seek emergency medical help if experiencing severe allergic reactions like anaphylaxis.

diseases.name: Arthritis
remedies: Maintain a healthy weight to reduce stress on joints.
Stay physically active with low-impact exercises like swimming or cycling.
Apply hot or cold packs to relieve pain and inflammation.
Take over-the-counter pain relievers or anti-inflammatory medications.
Consider physical therapy or occupational therapy for joint mobility and function.

diseases.name: Bronchial Asthma
remedies: Identify and avoid triggers such as allergens, smoke, or exercise-induced factors.
Use prescribed inhalers or medications as directed by a healthcare provider.
Practice breathing exercises and relaxation techniques.
Keep indoor air clean with air purifiers and regular cleaning.
Seek emergency medical help if experiencing severe asthma attacks.

diseases.name: Cervical spondylosis
symptoms: Loss of bowel or bladder control
remedies: Practice good posture and ergonomics to reduce strain on the neck and spine.
Use neck supports or cervical collars for pain relief and support.
Do gentle neck exercises and stretches to improve flexibility.
Apply heat or cold packs to alleviate muscle spasms and pain.
Consider physical therapy or chiropractic care for symptom management.

diseases.name: Chickenpox
remedies: Get plenty of rest and stay hydrated.
Take over-the-counter medications to relieve itching and fever.
Apply calamine lotion or oatmeal baths to soothe skin rashes.
Avoid scratching to prevent infection and scarring.
Isolate yourself to prevent spreading the virus to others.

diseases.name: Chronic cholestasis
remedies: Follow a low-fat diet to reduce bile production and ease symptoms.
Take medications as prescribed to relieve itching and improve liver function.
Consider procedures like endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP) or surgery in severe cases.
Monitor liver function through regular check-ups and blood tests.
Seek support from healthcare providers or support groups for managing the condition.

diseases.name: Common Cold
remedies: Get plenty of rest and stay hydrated.
Use over-the-counter cold medications to relieve symptoms like congestion and fever.
Gargle with salt water to soothe a sore throat.
Drink warm liquids like tea or broth to ease congestion.
Practice good hand hygiene to prevent spreading the cold virus.

diseases.name: Dengue
remedies: Stay hydrated by drinking plenty of fluids.
Take over-the-counter pain relievers to reduce fever and pain.
Get plenty of rest and avoid strenuous activities.
Monitor for warning signs of severe dengue and seek medical help if necessary.
Prevent mosquito bites by using insect repellent and wearing protective clothing.

diseases.name: Diabetes
symptoms: Tingling or numbness in hands and feet
remedies: Follow a healthy diet plan with balanced carbohydrates, proteins, and fats.
Monitor blood sugar levels regularly and adjust insulin or medication doses as needed.
Engage in regular physical activity to improve insulin sensitivity.
Maintain a healthy weight to reduce risk factors associated with diabetes.
Attend regular check-ups and screenings with healthcare providers.

diseases.name: Hemorrhoids (Piles)
remedies: Eat fiber-rich foods and drink plenty of water to prevent constipation.
Take over-the-counter pain relievers or topical creams to reduce pain and swelling.
Use sitz baths or warm water soaks to soothe the affected area.
Avoid straining during bowel movements and use soft toilet paper.
Consider procedures like rubber band ligation or surgery for severe hemorrhoids.

diseases.name: Drug Reaction
remedies: Stop taking the medication immediately if experiencing adverse reactions.
Seek medical help or contact a healthcare provider for guidance.
Take over-the-counter antihistamines to relieve symptoms like itching or rash.
Inform healthcare providers about any known drug allergies or reactions.
Avoid the triggering medication and seek alternative treatments if necessary.

diseases.name: Fungal Infection
remedies: Keep the affected area clean and dry.
Apply over-the-counter antifungal creams or powders.
Wear loose-fitting clothing to allow airflow to the affected area.
Avoid sharing personal items like towels or clothing.
Seek medical help for persistent or severe fungal infections.

diseases.name: Gastroenteritis
remedies: Stay hydrated by drinking clear fluids like water, broth, or electrolyte solutions.
Eat bland, easy-to-digest foods like rice, bananas, or toast.
Avoid dairy, caffeine, alcohol, and spicy foods until symptoms improve.
Practice good hand hygiene to prevent spreading the infection.
Seek medical help if symptoms worsen or persist for more than a few days.

diseases.name: GERD (Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease)
symptoms: Feeling of a lump in the throat
remedies: Avoid trigger foods like spicy, acidic, or fatty foods.
Eat smaller, more frequent meals and avoid lying down immediately after eating.
Raise the head of the bed to prevent acid reflux while sleeping.
Take over-the-counter antacids or medications to reduce stomach acid production.
Consider lifestyle changes like weight loss or quitting smoking.

diseases.name: Heart Attack
remedies: Call emergency services immediately if experiencing symptoms like chest pain, shortness of breath, or nausea.
Chew aspirin if prescribed by a healthcare provider to help prevent blood clots.
Stay calm and lie down while waiting for emergency medical help to arrive.
Follow medical advice and treatment plans provided by healthcare providers.
Attend cardiac rehabilitation programs for long-term recovery and prevention.

diseases.name: Hepatitis A
remedies: Practice good hygiene by washing hands thoroughly with soap and water.
Get vaccinated against hepatitis A to prevent infection.
Avoid consuming contaminated food or water, especially when traveling.
Seek medical help for symptoms like jaundice, fatigue, or abdominal pain.
Practice safe sex and avoid sharing needles to prevent transmission.

diseases.name: Hepatitis B
remedies: Get vaccinated against hepatitis B to prevent infection.
Practice safe sex by using condoms and avoid sharing needles.
Get tested for hepatitis B and seek medical help for treatment if infected.
Inform healthcare providers about hepatitis B status for medical procedures.
Avoid sharing personal items like toothbrushes or razors.

diseases.name: Hepatitis C
remedies: Get tested for hepatitis C and seek medical help for treatment if infected.
Practice safe sex by using condoms and avoid sharing needles.
Avoid sharing personal items like toothbrushes or razors.
Follow prescribed treatment plans and attend regular check-ups with healthcare providers.
Inform healthcare providers about hepatitis C status for medical procedures.

diseases.name: Hepatitis D
remedies: Get vaccinated against hepatitis B to prevent hepatitis D infection.
Avoid sharing needles or engaging in high-risk behaviors.
Seek medical help for treatment if infected with hepatitis D.
Follow prescribed treatment plans and attend regular check-ups with healthcare providers.
Inform healthcare providers about hepatitis D status for medical procedures.

diseases.name: Hepatitis E
remedies: Practice good hygiene by washing hands thoroughly with soap and water.
Avoid consuming contaminated food or water, especially when traveling.
Seek medical help for symptoms like jaundice, fatigue, or abdominal pain.
Get vaccinated against hepatitis E if traveling to high-risk areas.
Practice safe sex and avoid sharing needles to prevent transmission.

diseases.name: Hypertension (High Blood Pressure)
remedies: Follow a heart-healthy diet rich in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains.
Limit salt intake and avoid processed foods high in sodium.
Engage in regular physical activity to lower blood pressure.
Maintain a healthy weight and manage stress through relaxation techniques.
Take prescribed medications as directed by healthcare providers.

diseases.name: Hyperthyroidism
remedies: Take prescribed medications to control thyroid hormone levels.
Follow a balanced diet with iodine-rich foods like seafood and dairy products.
Avoid stimulants like caffeine and manage stress through relaxation techniques.
Attend regular check-ups and blood tests to monitor thyroid function.
Consider radioactive iodine therapy or thyroid surgery in severe cases.

diseases.name: Hypoglycemia (Low Blood Sugar)
remedies: Eat or drink something with fast-acting carbohydrates like juice or candy.
Check blood sugar levels regularly and carry snacks for emergencies.
Follow a balanced diet with regular meals and snacks throughout the day.
Avoid excessive alcohol consumption, especially on an empty stomach.
Seek medical help if experiencing severe or recurrent hypoglycemia.

diseases.name: Hypothyroidism
remedies: Take prescribed thyroid hormone replacement medication as directed by a healthcare provider.
Follow a balanced diet with iodine-rich foods like seafood and dairy products.
Engage in regular physical activity to boost metabolism and energy levels.
Attend regular check-ups and blood tests to monitor thyroid function.
Manage stress through relaxation techniques and adequate sleep.

diseases.name: Impetigo
remedies: Keep the affected area clean and dry.
Apply over-the-counter antibiotic ointments or creams.
Avoid scratching or picking at sores to prevent spreading the infection.
Cover sores with bandages to protect them from bacteria.
Seek medical help for severe or persistent cases of impetigo.

diseases.name: Jaundice
remedies: Get plenty of rest and stay hydrated.
Eat a balanced diet with foods rich in antioxidants and liver-supportive nutrients.
Avoid alcohol and medications that can further stress the liver.
Take prescribed medications as directed by healthcare providers.
Seek medical help for underlying causes of jaundice, such as liver disease.

diseases.name: Malaria
remedies: Take prescribed antimalarial medications before, during, and after travel to malaria-endemic areas.
Use insect repellents and bed nets to prevent mosquito bites.
Seek medical help promptly if experiencing symptoms like fever, chills, or flu-like illness.
Follow prescribed treatment plans and complete the full course of medications.
Stay informed about malaria risks and prevention strategies when traveling.

diseases.name: Migraine
remedies: Identify and avoid triggers such as certain foods, stress, or lack of sleep.
Take prescribed migraine medications as directed by a healthcare provider.
Apply cold packs to the forehead or neck to alleviate pain and nausea.
Practice relaxation techniques like deep breathing or meditation.
Maintain a regular sleep schedule and stay hydrated.

diseases.name: Osteoarthritis
remedies: Maintain a healthy weight to reduce stress on joints.
Engage in regular physical activity to improve joint flexibility and strength.
Use over-the-counter pain relievers or topical creams to alleviate pain.
Consider physical therapy or occupational therapy for joint mobility and function.
Use assistive devices like braces or canes for support if needed.

diseases.name: Paralysis (brain hemorrhage)
remedies: Seek emergency medical help immediately.
Follow medical advice and treatment plans provided by healthcare providers.
Attend rehabilitation programs for physical and occupational therapy.
Provide emotional support and encouragement to the individual and their caregivers.
Make necessary accommodations for mobility and accessibility.

diseases.name: Peptic Ulcer Disease
remedies: Avoid trigger foods like spicy or acidic foods that can irritate the stomach lining.
Take prescribed medications such as proton pump inhibitors or H2 blockers to reduce stomach acid production.
Avoid nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) that can worsen ulcers.
Quit smoking and limit alcohol consumption.
Follow a balanced diet with regular meals and snacks.

diseases.name: Pneumonia
remedies: Take prescribed antibiotics as directed by a healthcare provider.
Get plenty of rest and stay hydrated.
Use over-the-counter medications to relieve fever, cough, and congestion.
Practice good respiratory hygiene by covering mouth and nose when coughing or sneezing.
Attend follow-up appointments for monitoring and treatment evaluation.

diseases.name: Psoriasis
remedies: Moisturize skin regularly to reduce dryness and itching.
Take prescribed medications as directed by a healthcare provider, such as topical creams or oral medications.
Expose skin to sunlight in moderation to help improve symptoms.
Avoid triggers like stress, smoking, and excessive alcohol consumption.
Attend regular check-ups with dermatologists for monitoring and treatment adjustments.

diseases.name: Tuberculosis
remedies: Take prescribed antibiotics for the full duration of treatment as directed by a healthcare provider.
Stay isolated from others until no longer contagious.
Cover mouth and nose with a tissue or mask when coughing or sneezing.
Practice good hygiene by washing hands frequently and avoiding close contact with others.
Attend follow-up appointments for monitoring and treatment evaluation.

diseases.name: Typhoid
remedies: Take prescribed antibiotics as directed by a healthcare provider.
Stay hydrated by drinking clean water and electrolyte solutions.
Eat bland, easy-to-digest foods like rice, bananas, or toast.
Practice good hygiene by washing hands thoroughly and avoiding contaminated food or water.
Attend follow-up appointments and screenings for monitoring and prevention.

diseases.name: Urinary Tract Infection
remedies: Drink plenty of water to flush out bacteria from the urinary tract.
Take prescribed antibiotics as directed by a healthcare provider.
Avoid irritants like caffeine, alcohol, and spicy foods.
Practice good hygiene by wiping from front to back and urinating after intercourse.
Seek medical help if symptoms worsen or persist despite treatment.

diseases.name: Varicose Veins
symptoms: Veins that are dark purple or blue
Veins that appear twisted or bulging
Aching or pain in the legs
Burning or throbbing in the legs
Itching around one or more veins
Skin discoloration around a varicose vein
remedies: Elevate legs above heart level to reduce swelling and improve circulation.
Wear compression stockings to support veins and reduce discomfort.
Exercise regularly to improve muscle tone and blood flow.
Avoid prolonged sitting or standing and take regular breaks to move around.
Consider procedures like sclerotherapy or laser therapy for severe varicose veins.
